  name={<><a href="#a978871b5919763e0bf8bfe0fbfca93e6">createLinker</a> (MessageHandlerTy ErrorHandler, MessageHandlerTy WarningHandler, std::function&lt; StringRef(StringRef)&gt; StringsTranslator=nullptr)</>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

The core of the Dwarf linking logic.

The generation of the dwarf information from the object files will be driven by the selection of &#39;root DIEs&#39;, which are DIEs that describe variables or functions that resolves to the corresponding code section(and thus have entries in the Addresses map). All the debug information that will be generated(the DIEs, but also the line
tables, ranges, ...) is derived from that set of root DIEs.

The root DIEs are identified because they contain relocations that points to code section(the low&#95;pc for a function, the location for
a variable). These relocations are called ValidRelocs in the AddressesInfo and are gathered as a very first step when we start processing a object file.

Definition at line 211 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/dwarflinker/include/llvm/dwarflinker/classic/dwarflinker-h">DWARFLinker.h</a>.
